result.execSummary:
The defendant Euddy L Guerrero-Arias was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety By Use of Dangerous Weapon (Under The Influence of Intoxicant), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $1000.00 including all  costs, fees and dna surcharges to be paid by 10-7-15 or serve 20 consecutive days in the House of Correction.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and treatment. Court stayed the commencment until 10-9-15 . Defendant to provide DNA sample.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety By Use of Dangerous Weapon (Under The Influence of Intoxicant)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Euddy L Guerrero-Arias

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Euddy L Guerrero-Arias in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve  one month  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and treatment. Court stayed the commencment until 10-9-15 . Defendant to provide DNA sample.     Fine of $1000.00 including all  costs, fees and dna surcharges to be paid by 10-7-15 or serve 20 consecutive days in the House of Correction.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Euddy L Guerrero-Arias in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 47. lr  Jury trial scheduled for 10-12-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Euddy L Guerrero-Arias in court with attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger for attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 08-06-2015 at 01:30pm
